00001 //_____________________________________________
00002 //
00003 // KEvent.cxx
00004 // KDataStructure
00005 //
00006 // Author: Adam Cox <mailto:adam.cox@ik.fzk.de> on 3/3/10.
00007 //
00008 // * Copyright 2010 Karlsruhe Institute of Technology. All rights reserved.
00009 //
00010 // This is the "mother" of all KDS Event classes. It contains some basic
00011 // event parameters. Most importantly, however, is that many analysis objects
00012 // can exploit C++ polymorphism by writing code that pass a pointer of
00013 // this type (instead of a pointer to KHLAEvent or KRawEvent) and then
00014 // handling the event pointer appropriately using dynamic casting. 
00015 // 
00016 // 
00017 
00018 #include "KEvent.h"
00019 #include <iostream>
00020 
00021 using namespace std;
00022 
00023 ClassImp(KEvent);
00024 
00025 KEvent::KEvent(void) 
00026 {
00027         //
00028         
00029         //note from the ROOT documentation
00030 /*      The Default Constructor
00031         ROOT object I/O requires every class to have either a default constructor or an I/O constructor. 
00032  A default constructor is a constructor with zero parameters or with one or more parameters all with default values. 
00033  An I/O constructor is a constructor with exactly one parameter which type is a pointer to one of the type 
00034  marked as an 'io constructor type'. We will come back to this context in a few paragraphs. This default or I/O 
00035  constructor is called whenever an object is being read from a ROOT database. Be sure that you do not allocate 
00036  any space for embedded pointer objects in this constructor. This space will be lost (memory leak) while reading 
00037  in the object. 
00038  
00039  And, I broke that rule in the KHLAEvent because I allocate memory for the TClonesArrays.
00040  */
00041         InitializeMembers();
00042 
00043 }
00044 
00045 KEvent::KEvent(const KEvent &anEvent)
00046 :TObject()
00047 {
00048         CopyLocalMembers(anEvent);
00049         
00050 }
00051 
00052 KEvent& KEvent::operator=(const KEvent &anEvent)
00053 {
00054 #ifdef _K_DEBUG_EVENT_ASSIGNOP
00055         cout << "base = base" << endl;
00056 #endif
00057         if(&anEvent == this) return *this;
00058         
00059         CopyLocalMembers(anEvent);
00060         
00061         return *this;
00062 }
00063 
00064 void KEvent::CopyLocalMembers(const KEvent &anEvent)
00065 {
00066         SetRunNumber(anEvent.GetRunNumber());
00067         SetEventTriggerTime(anEvent.GetEventTriggerTime()); 
00068         SetStamp(anEvent.GetStamp());
00069         SetRunStartTime(anEvent.GetRunStartTime());
00070         SetRunEndTime(anEvent.GetRunEndTime());
00071         SetTriggerType(anEvent.GetTriggerType()); 
00072         //SetDataType(anEvent.GetDataType());
00073         //SetDetectorStatusWord(anEvent.GetDetectorStatusWord());
00074         //SetBlindnessWord(anEvent.GetBlindnessWord());
00075         SetGSEventNumber(anEvent.GetGSEventNumber());   
00076         
00077 }
00078 
00079 KEvent::~KEvent(void) 
00080 {
00081         Clear("C");
00082 }
00083 
00084 void KEvent::Clear(Option_t * /*anOption*/)
00085 {
00086         
00087         //delete any memory allocated by the KEvent class here that
00088         //needs to be deleted for each event -- but not the TClonesArrays. Clear should be called 
00089         //after every event so that the TClonesArrays are cleared. 
00090         
00091         InitializeMembers();
00092 }
00093 
00094 
00095 void KEvent::InitializeMembers(void)    
00096 {
00097         //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS
00098         //ONLY SET MEMBERS ON THE STACK TO THEIR INITIAL VALUES
00099         
00100         SetRunNumber(-99);
00101         SetEventTriggerTime(-99.0); 
00102         SetStamp(-99);
00103         SetRunStartTime(-99.0);
00104         SetRunEndTime(-99.0);
00105         SetTriggerType(0); //initialize this to zero, instead of -99 so that AddTriggerType works.
00106         //SetDataType(-99);
00107         //SetDetectorStatusWord(-99);
00108         //SetBlindnessWord(-99);
00109         SetGSEventNumber(-99);  
00110 }

00112 Bool_t KEvent::operator==(const KEvent &anEvent) const
00113 {
00114         //returns true of both events are EXACTLY the same
00115         //this is most useful as a test of the copy constructors
00116         return IsSame(anEvent,false);
00117 }
00118 
00119 Bool_t KEvent::IsSame(const KEvent &anEvent, Bool_t bPrint) const
00120 {
00121         //same as operator==, but with the option to print out whenever it finds
00122         //a difference.
00123         
00124         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00125 
00126 
00127         if(fRunNumber != anEvent.fRunNumber){
00128                 if (bPrint) 
00129                         cout << "KEvent fRunNumber Not Equal" << endl;          
00130                 bIsEqual = false;
00131                 if(!bPrint)
00132                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00133                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00134         }
00135         
00136         if(fRunStartTime != anEvent.fRunStartTime){
00137                 if (bPrint) 
00138                         cout << "KEvent fRunStartTime Not Equal" << endl;               
00139                 bIsEqual = false;
00140                 if(!bPrint)
00141                         return false;  
00142         }
00143         
00144         if(fRunEndTime != anEvent.fRunEndTime){
00145                 if (bPrint) 
00146                         cout << "KEvent fRunEndTime Not Equal" << endl;         
00147                 bIsEqual = false;
00148                 if(!bPrint)
00149                         return false;  
00150         }
00151         
00152         if(fEventTriggerTime != anEvent.fEventTriggerTime){
00153                 if (bPrint) 
00154                         cout << "KEvent fEventTriggerTime Not Equal" << endl;           
00155                 bIsEqual = false;
00156                 if(!bPrint)
00157                         return false;  
00158         }
00159         
00160         if(fStamp != anEvent.fStamp){
00161                 if (bPrint) 
00162                         cout << "KEvent fStamp Not Equal" << endl;              
00163                 bIsEqual = false;
00164                 if(!bPrint)
00165                         return false;  
00166         }
00167         
00168         if(fTriggerType != anEvent.fTriggerType){
00169                 if (bPrint) 
00170                         cout << "KEvent fTriggerType Not Equal" << endl;                
00171                 bIsEqual = false;
00172                 if(!bPrint)
00173                         return false;  
00174         }
00175         
00176         /*if(fDataType != anEvent.fDataType){
00177                 if (bPrint) 
00178                         cout << "KEvent fDataType Not Equal" << endl;           
00179                 bIsEqual = false;
00180                 if(!bPrint)
00181                         return false;  
00182         }*/
00183         
00184         /*if(fDetectorStatusWord != anEvent.fDetectorStatusWord){
00185                 if (bPrint) 
00186                         cout << "KEvent fDetectorStatusWord Not Equal" << endl;         
00187                 bIsEqual = false;
00188                 if(!bPrint)
00189                         return false;  
00190         }*/
00191         
00192         /*if(fBlindnessWord != anEvent.fBlindnessWord){
00193                 if (bPrint) 
00194                         cout << "KEvent fBlindnessWord Not Equal" << endl;              
00195                 bIsEqual = false;
00196                 if(!bPrint)
00197                         return false;  
00198         }*/
00199         
00200         if(fGSEventNumber != anEvent.fGSEventNumber){
00201                 if (bPrint) 
00202                         cout << "KEvent fGSEventNumber Not Equal" << endl;              
00203                 bIsEqual = false;
00204                 if(!bPrint)
00205                         return false;  
00206         }
00207         
00208         return bIsEqual;
00209 }

00211 Bool_t KEvent::IsBlind(void) const 
00212 {
00213         //returns true if you are officially Blind by this event. 
00214         //If this returns true, then you should not analyze this event.
00215         
00216         //check the fBlindnessWord for a particular bit pattern
00217         return false;
00218 
00219 }

00221 Double_t KEvent::GetSecPerStamp(void) const
00222 {
00223         //returns the number of seconds that each Opera stamp spans.
00224         //Currently, each stamp value is 10 microseconds long. 
00225         return 1.e-5;
00226 }
00227 
00228 Double_t KEvent::GetStampTime(void) const
00229 {
00230         //returns the stamp time in seconds.  
00231         //return GetSecPerStamp() * GetStamp();
00232         
00233         return GetSecPerStamp() * GetStamp();
00234 }
